content:
I'm going to let my imagination guide me for now. I have a few ideas floating around in my head, but I want to see where the process takes me. I do know that I want to create something that captures the essence of the impressionist exhibit I saw at the museum. The way the artist used light and color to evoke a sense of atmosphere and mood really resonated with me. I'm hoping to tap into that same feeling in my own work.

Speaking of the exhibit, I was thinking about the book I bought at the museum gift shop. It's been really inspiring me to try new things and experiment with different techniques. Have you ever found that looking at other artists' work or reading about their process can be really helpful in sparking your own creativity?
